an4.180:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near the city of Bhoga, at the Ānanda Tree-shrine.
an4.180:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an4.180:4.6: “Mendicants, I will teach you the four great references. Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
an4.180:5.1: “Mendicants, what are the four great references?
an4.180:5.3: “Reverend, I have heard and learned this directly from the Buddha:
an4.180:5.4: this is the teaching, this is the Vinaya, this is the Teacher’s instruction.’
an4.180:5.5: You should neither approve nor dismiss that mendicant’s statement.
an4.180:5.6: Instead, you should carefully memorize those words and phrases, then check if they’re included in the discourses or found in the Vinaya.
an4.180:5.7: If they’re not included in the discourses or found in the Vinaya, you should draw the conclusion:
an4.180:5.8: ‘Clearly this is not the word of the Blessed One, the Perfect One, the fully awakened Buddha.
an4.180:5.9: It has been incorrectly memorized by that mendicant.’
an4.180:5.10: And so you should reject it.
